author: mklement0
body:
Even failed attempts to navigate to a location are currently recorded in the automatically maintained history of locations, which is unexpected and pointless.

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
cd /
cd $HOME
cd nosuch
cd -
$pwd.ProviderPath | should -not -be $HOME
```

# Expected behavior

The test should pass, because `cd -` should return to the user's home dir. - the failed navigation attempt to `nosuch` should be ignored with respect to the location history.

# Actual behavior

The test fails, because the failed attempt to navigate to dir. `nosuch` was unexpectedly recorded in the history of locations.

```none
Expected '/Users/jdoe' to be different from the actual value, but got the same value.
```

# Environment data

```none
PowerShell Core 7.0.0-rc.2
```
title: + / - location-history navigation via Set-Location / cd unexpectedly records failed attempts to change the location in the history too
